Exaggerate: The claim that the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation was "kicked out" of India exaggerates the situation. The foundation was not actually kicked out of India, as it continues to work in the country.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a rumor that has been circulating online since 2017. There is no factual evidence or official statement to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Gates Foundation's work in India was fraudulent and that their intention was to "vaccinate" children without proper consent. This assumption is problematic as it lacks evidence and is based on speculative allegations.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that the Gates Foundation continues to work in India and has ongoing projects focused on reducing poverty and improving access to healthcare, particularly in the Uttar Pradesh and Bihar regions.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Gates Foundation was not kicked out of India and is still actively involved in various projects in the country.
